column3: When Rabbits Sleep: A Narrative Game about Ōkunoshima’s Hidden Past
column4: When Rabbits Sleep: A Narrative Game about Oh-koo-noh-she-ma’s Hidden Past
column5: Savannah Both (suh-VAN-uh bohth), Communication Design, Texas State University
column6: When the Rabbits Sleep: A Narrative Game about Ōkunoshima's Hidden Past places players in the shoes of a young girl working on Ōkunoshima during the Pacific War. Through daily tasks, interactions, and mini-games, the game reveals the hidden realities of labor, secrecy, and chemical production long kept from the public. Between days on the island, players also experience life in the future, guiding a mother as she navigates the lingering effects of the island’s secrets. When the Rabbits Sleep explores how withheld history shapes lives across generations and invites reflection on what remains unspoken.
column13: Savannah Both is a graduating senior at Texas State University, majoring in Communication Design. She is an illustrator and storyteller who loves research and exploring hidden histories that often go untold. While her main focus is UX/UI, she is passionate about how people interact with the world and enjoys turning those insights into immersive, narrative-driven experiences. Her work, whether a game, website, or painting, aims to encourage the audience to reflect, discover, and connect with stories in unexpected ways.

column5: Credit Texas State Universities Communication Design Program + Nishra (Pronunciation - NIH-shrah)
column6: Nature's Desire is a demo game that follows a young child left alone in a cabin in the woods navigating interactions with strange visitors. Though kind, these visitors seem a bit off...it may be best to not L̴̛͇͉͗͜Ẹ̷͑̈́T̸̛͎̟̃ͅ.̷̦̆̚T̴̤̂̔H̵͚̰͠Ĕ̵̟̯͗̾M̷͎͕̀̇.̴̹̹̪́̄I̵̖̥͂N̵̜͑͜.
column13: Heyo! I'm Edrick, a senior student currently studying at Texas State University learning about UX/UI Design! But on the side, I'm an artist, baker, learning to create my own music for fun, and obsessed with playing Overwatch! The game presented was created in Figma as a fun project for us to see what we could do.

column6: In Detective Academy, observation is everything! As a rookie detective in training, you’ll take on a series of levels designed to test your focus, memory, and attention to detail. Each scene is filled with items to spot and recall under pressure. The academy’s Chief and senior detectives will track your progress as you rise through the ranks. Stay sharp, prove your skills, and show you’ve got what it takes to become a top investigator!
column13: I'm a Communication Design student at Texas State University. In my free time, I do illustration and graphic novel work, and I’ve recently started incorporating illustration into my graphic design and UI/UX projects. I hope to work on more gaming projects in the future!

column5: Mary Gavrilova (MAIR-ee gah-VREE-loh-vah, any), Mason Mockler (MAY-suhn MOCK-lur, they/he/she), Jadon Putman (JAY-duhn PUT-muhn, he/him), Max Somarriba (MAKS soh-mah-REE-bah, he/him), Sarina Varela (sah-REE-nuh vah-RAY-lah, she/he), John Vu (JON voo, he/him), Alexander Wilson (AL-ig-ZAN-dur WIL-suhn, he/him)
column6: V-Shift is a high-intensity, fast-paced, battle platformer where mastering your movement is key to victory. Choose your champion and become the ultimate gladiator in a galaxy-wide alien arena. Master the V-Shift: velocity is damage; stillness is death.
column13: At Propel Studios, we embrace the conflict of ideas and chaos of creativity as tools to improve! Each member of our team, coming from different skill-sets and gaming backgrounds, provides their unique outlook to V-Shift, while sharing in a joint passion for creation and games.

column6: In Choose Your Sorcery, it is a simple game to pass time when you're bored and possibly risk some dabloons just for the fun of it. You'll never know what you'll get from the three different wizards you'll choose from. Just a simple card game with a twist of magic.
column13: I am currently a Texas State Communication Design student, focusing in branding, UI/UX and motion graphics.

column5: Communication Design, Texas State University: Angel Roman: he/him, main developer and artist. Daniel Duarte, main composer.
column6: Astra is a young wizard attending Moonrise Academy, a famous but rigorous school best known for its night classes, in dreams of becoming a well-known wizard capable of complex and difficult spells and magic. However, one fateful chilly December evening, Astra overslept and woke up late to his class. Your objective is to help Astra collect all 8 of his items needed to pass his final exam in under 10 minutes. Will you be able to help Astra pass his final exam, or run out of time?
column13: I am a graphic designer from Brownsville, TX interested in UI/UX for video games, typography, branding, and illustration using Adobe programs such as Illustrator, InDesign, Photoshop, and Figma! The closer I get to graduating in Communication Design, the more I find graphic design for video games fascinating and an art field I'd really love to pursue. I had a ton of fun creating Dormlight Dusk on Figma and hope to continue the art of game development in the future!
